name: nested_json_codeact
requirements: You are a data analyst. A nested JSON 'company' object is available with departments, teams, and members. Navigate the structure and output results as JSON: {{"result": <complex_nested_data>}}. Include ALL fields and nested data - do not summarize.

turns.query: Extract the complete Engineering department with all its nested data (id, name, budget, location, teams array with all members). Output as JSON: {"result": {"id": ..., "name": "Engineering", "budget": ..., "location": ..., "teams": [{"id": ..., "name": ..., "focus": ..., "members": [...]}]}}

Find all staff-level members (level='Staff') with their full details and context. Output as JSON: {"result": [{"member": {id, name, salary, level, skills, projects}, "team": "team_name", "department": "dept_name"}, ...]}

Find all members who have 'Python' in their skills. Include id, name, salary, level, all skills, all projects, team name, and department name. Output as JSON: {"result": [{"id": ..., "name": ..., "salary": ..., "level": ..., "skills": [...], "projects": [...], "team": ..., "department": ...}, ...]}

Create department summaries with: id, name, budget, location, team_count, total_salary, budget_remaining, and teams array (each team with id, name, focus, member_count, total_salary, members array with id/name/level). Output as JSON: {"result": [{...}, ...]}

Create project assignments showing which members work on each project. Output as JSON: {"result": [{"project": "project_name", "members": [{"id": ..., "name": ..., "team": ..., "department": ...}, ...]}, ...]} sorted by project name

Create a skills matrix mapping each unique skill to all members who have it. Output as JSON: {"result": {"skill_name": [{"id": ..., "name": ..., "level": ...}, ...], ...}} with skills sorted alphabetically

Create team comparison with stats: team_id, team_name, department, focus, member_count, total_salary, avg_salary (rounded to 2 decimals), min_salary, max_salary. Output as JSON: {"result": [{...}, ...]}

Find high earners (salary > 150000) with full context. Output as JSON: {"result": [{"member": {full member data}, "team": {id, name, focus}, "department": {id, name, location}}, ...]} sorted by salary descending

Find cross-functional projects (projects with members from multiple departments). Output as JSON: {"result": [{"project": ..., "departments": [sorted list], "member_count": N, "members": [{id, name, department, team}, ...]}, ...]} sorted by project name

Create full org chart: company, founded, headquarters, total_departments, total_teams, total_members, total_budget, departments array (each with id, name, budget, location, teams array with id, name, focus, members array with id, name, level, salary). Output as JSON: {"result": {...}}
